meanings.definition: Extreme greed for wealth or material gain.
meanings.sent1: His avarices knew no bounds as he hoarded every penny he earned.
meanings.sent2: Her avarices drove her to work long hours in pursuit of more money.
meanings.sent3: The avarices of the miserly old man led him to hide his savings under the mattress.
meanings.sent4: The avarices of the corporation were evident in their relentless pursuit of profit above all else.
meanings.sent5: The avarices of the dragon were legendary, as it hoarded gold in its mountain lair.

meanings.definition: Strong desire to have or get money.
meanings.sent1: Their avarices were fueled by dreams of a luxurious lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: The avarices of the young entrepreneur motivated him to start his own business.
meanings.sent3: Despite his humble appearance, his avarices for wealth were well-known in the town.
meanings.sent4: The avarices of the gambler led him to risk everything in the hopes of a big win.
meanings.sent5: In the fairy tale, the princess's avarices for gold led her to make a dangerous deal with a sorcerer.
